string.text: performing new rituals that treat the ruler as semi-divine
{VALUE}% damage bonus from speed with polearms by troops in your formation.
{WOUNDED_NUMBER} of your men got wounded while they were trying to separate the two sides.
Party becomes disorganized
{VALUE}% handling of swingable polearms.
You are a wanted criminal.
You have tried to persuade me before. I will not stand your words again.
{TOURNAMENT_ROUND_GOAL}{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} will certainly be disappointed.
Go on...

Yes, there's a lot of work we need to do around the village, and we're short on the materials that our smith needs to make us tools and fittings. Do you think you could get us some? We'll pay well.[ib:demure][if:convo_dismayed]
{VALUE}% fortification bonus to the governed settlement
Your family were small farmers with just enough land to feed themselves and make a small profit. People like them were the pillars of the imperial rural economy, as well as the backbone of the levy.
{VALUE} daily experience to infantry in your party.
{VALUE}% reload speed to mangonels and trebuchets in siege bombardment.
{VALUE} companion limit.
Jobs for the Lads
Give him your blessing and encourage him to bore everyone to tears with his old war stories.
Make peace with the {KINGDOM_NAME}. No tribute will be paid.
{FIRSTNAME} the Lizard
{LORD.NAME} is a member of the {CLAN_NAME}, {CLAN_DESCRIPTION} of the {FACTION_NAME} that is backing {RULER} in the civil war. {?LORD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} has the reputation of being {REPUTATION}.
Cover the bodies as best you can and hope for the best
The {KINGDOM1_LINK} has formed an alliance with the {KINGDOM2_LINK}.
You may know me as a {?PLAYER.GENDER}woman{?}man{\?} of honor.
Yes, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madam{?}sir{\?}. Thank you.
Call the {CALLED_KINGDOM} to War Against the {KINGDOM_TO_CALL_TO_WAR_AGAINST} for {CALL_TO_WAR_COST}
{VALUE}% damage with bows by troops in your formation.
Mounted weapon damage penalty: {a0}%
You are commanding the besiegers.

After observing the terrain around {FORTRESS_NAME}, you think conditions might be appropriate for mining - digging a tunnel under a wall, then collapsing it. This can open a breach but is time-consuming and risky. If you encounter rock underground, you may find all your efforts go to waste. If the ground is too soft, the tunnel may collapse and bury your men. Most troops are reluctant to spend time in dark, confined tunnels unless they are paid extra, or forced.
This is a dangerous step, however, and I'm putting my life and the lives of my people at risk. I need some sort of support from you before I can change my allegiance.[if:convo_stern]
I would like to enter {FACTION_SERVICE_TERM}.
I have no answer to that.
Rooster theft
As {?IS_FEMALE}queen{?}king{\?} you must decide whether to enforce the policy of {POLICY_NAME}.
Very good. Keep them coming.[if:convo_mocking_aristocratic]
You can not help but notice how people are put at ease by {?PLAYER_CHILD}your {?CHILD.GENDER}daughter{?}son{\?}{?}the {?CHILD.GENDER}girl{?}boy{\?}{\?} and seek {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} company.
{BASE} Minimum
You cannot devastate a settlement that has your faction culture.{newline}
I am thinking of a different attribute.
Well... I don't know what to say. Goodbye, then.
{ARMY_OWNER_TEXT} {ARMY_BEHAVIOR}
Your relation with notables in some of your settlements increased due to high loyalty
taxing landowners on their property

Or, maybe one of your trusted companions can buy the {ITEM_TYPE}. I reckon they'll cost {COMPANION_NEED_GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} denars, and they'd best take at least {ALTERNATIVE_TROOP_AMOUNT} men for protection.[if:convo_bored]
{VALUE} bow skill to horse archers in your formation
{VALUE} daily experience to infantry troops in your party.
Return the rooster and have your man whipped.
A gang leader needs recruits for {?ISSUE_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} gang.

Sedition? You have been misinformed. My men and I are loyal servants of {RULER_NAME_AND_TITLE}. We are simply going about informing the people that our {RULER_TITLE} is surrounded by bad advisers who wish to raise their taxes. We petition {RULER.NAME} to listen to {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} people and their needs.[if:convo_normal][ib:hip]
{VALUE}% damage with throwing weapons by mounted troops in your formation.
Tell your men to be forgiving, as they were once recruits themselves
Surely you know that {FIRST_NAME} is {RELATIONSHIP} as well as my liege, and will always be able to count on my loyalty.
{VALUE} one handed skill to infantry troops in your formation.
Hunting Rights
{?CHARACTER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} retired from adventuring, and was last seen with a group of mountain hermits living a life of quiet contemplation.
I must say something. Your men say their wages are late. We should take care that this doesn't happen.
{RULER.NAME} of the {KINGDOM} grants {SETTLEMENT} to {LEADER.NAME} with {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council's support.
Sure. We will wait other parties around {GATHERING_SETTLEMENT} for a while, then follow us.
Reject the landlord's request for money and collect revenues as before.
I'll accept that.
Is this a joke? You've some nerve asking me for favours, {PLAYER.NAME}, and let me assure you you'll get none.[if:convo_stern]
{VALUE}% troops left behind when escaping from battles.
Walk It Off
Tenants are forbidden from leaving the lands of their lords without notice.
I'll be waiting. Good luck.[if:convo_relaxed_happy][ib:confident]

Your father was a bailiff for a local feudal magnate. He looked after his liege's estates, resolved disputes in the village, and helped train the village levy. He rode with the lord's cavalry, fighting as an armored knight.
{VALUE}% casualty chance from siege bombardments.
We await your success, {?PLAYER.GENDER}milady{?}sir{\?}.[if:convo_nervous]
I recently bought the right to graze cattle near the village of {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}. Good pastureland is hard to find. But now the locals are giving my herdsmen trouble.[if:convo_thinking][ib:closed]
Very well, then...
Attack army
{?AMOUNT >= 1}Received{?}Lost{\?} {ABS(AMOUNT)} {?AMOUNT > 1}{PLURAL(ITEM)}{?}{ITEM}{\?}.
Sturgia snow bonus
Abandon Army
{VALUE}% reload speed with bows.
At the same time, {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} shows {?PLAYER_IS_MOTHER}your{?}{?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} mother's{\?}....
Thank you. I cannot guarantee I'd do the same for you, but I thank you.
Caravan entered {SETTLEMENT_LINK}.
Wall Breaker
I'm afraid I don't have time to fight but I can use my influence.
Show genuine remorse and participate in the burial rites for the deer, just in case, even if your troops make comments behind your back
You don't seem trustworthy. I have no interest in your offer.
Tell the trader that you have no wish to profit from his ignorance
Armies led by Tier 5+ nobles require 10% less influence{newline}Influence of the ruler clan is reduced by 1 per day
Tell {NOBLE.NAME} that your people will get their reeds elsewhere and stop frightening off the game.
The noble did not let {CHILD.NAME} go hand-to-hand with other warriors, but the young {?CHILD.GENDER}woman{?}man{\?} joined the archers as they traded shots with enemy scouts.
Forest Kin
Feeling the Bite
I'll bring your {?MOUNT_TYPE_IS_CAMEL}camels{?}horses{\?} by myself.
Upgraded {AMOUNT} of your {TROOP.NAME} to {UPGRADED_TROOP.NAME}
Your clan is now owner of the town from which the goods were stolen. As the lord of the settlement you cannot get involved in deals of this kind. Your agreement with {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is canceled.
Let the wealthier merchant know that your decision is for sale.
{VALUE}% recovery of lost hit points after each battle.
Saber Tooth Tiger
You were unable to drive the herders from the disputed pasture. The landowner, {QUEST_GIVER.LINK}, probably feels that you let {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} down.
Tell him that no one sells maps to treasures that they could just as easily dig up themselves
Speculative Investment
May the winds serve you well.
I was planning to entrust one of my people to you, but it seems you have enough companions in your party.
Take too much time, and my men will swing from the gallows. Speed it along, will you?
Public Speaker
You will end the siege if you leave. Are you sure?
{PEACEMAKER_RULER.NAME} of the {KINGDOM_CONSIDERING_PEACE} has decided to make peace with the {KINGDOM} with the support of {?PEACEMAKER_RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.
Polearm weapon damage: +{a0}%
Hmm.. No... {IMMEDIATE_FAILURE_LINE}
There are no nobles to meet.
Your contract with the {QUEST_GIVER.NAME} is still in force. I can't let you go without {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} permission.
The {ENEMY_KINGDOM_INFORMAL_NAME} may be strong, but their lands are rich and ripe for the taking.
Thank you. Your service will be remembered.
As {?IS_FEMALE}queen{?}king{\?} you must decide whether to disavow the policy of {POLICY_NAME}.
Tell them they can join you and be as arrogant as they like - so long as they beat one of your men in a duel to first blood.
We should award this fief to a new clan
{VALUE}% armor while on foot.
defeats an enemy.
I am {CONVERSATION_HERO.FIRSTNAME}. I own land around here. I speak for many of the people in this village.
Sell him your cheapest horse so that he can continue.
Wind Winder
Vintage of Victory
Pay {FINE}{INFLUENCE_ICON}
{VALUE}% learning rate of new part designs when smelting.
I just hope you can deliver the herd soon.
shooting at targets.
Discarded armors are donated to troops for increased experience.

Ah, yes. I am afraid I can no longer entertain such a proposal. I am now the head of my family, and the factors that we must consider have changed. You would need to place your property under my control, and I do not think that you would accept that.

All profitable trade routes of the caravan are blocked by recent wars. {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} decided to recall the caravan until the situation gets better. {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} was happy with your service and sent you {REWARD}{GOLD_ICON} as promised.
{VALUE}% garrison wages in the governed castle.
My deals are none of your business, merchant.
What I mentioned about running from battle...
{KINGDOM1_LINK} has signed a trade agreement with {KINGDOM2_LINK}.
{FIRSTNAME} of the Staff
Scout the keep
You are my prisoners now.
Ah... Well, I am afraid that is not enough.
{VALUE}% mounted melee damage.

Deliver the prisoner to {ISSUE_OWNER.LINK} {?ISSUE_OWNER.GENDER}herself{?}himself{\?} or one of {?ISSUE_OWNER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} settlements. If you don't want to deliver {TARGET_HERO.LINK}, talk with {?TARGET_HERO.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} to negotiate on {?TARGET_HERO.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} release.
Here are some documents from the chancellery.
You are not in command of this siege.
But I'm sure you won't disappoint me. Enjoy your riches![if:convo_focused_happy][ib:confident]
Have you found any good men?[ib:confident3]

Not everyone who musters for the levy marches to war, and not everyone who goes on campaign sees action. You did both, and you also took down an enemy warrior in direct one-to-one combat, in the full view of your comrades.
Carry on, then. Farewell.
{VALUE}% chance per day to increase relation with a notable by 1 in the governed settlement.

As you pass through the village streets, a dog dashes out from among some spectators and bites at the heels of one of your {CAVALRYMAN}'s horses, panicking it. The mount rears and gallops down the street, trampling a vegetable vendor who was unable to get out of its way. She will probably walk with a limp hereafter, and her family demands compensation.
You don't have enough gold to do this.
Veteran Mentor
Your tutor throws up his hands in the air at {CHILD.NAME}'s ability to lie {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} way out of trouble, but can't help but admire it a little.
Oh, thank you {PLAYER.NAME}. You will always be remembered by our people. Farewell.[if:convo_merry]
{VALUE} ammunition for throwing weapons to troops in your party.

I have a mine near here. We had an unfortunate accident a week back. Two workers were crushed to death. It's a great shame... but work must go on. Trouble is, no one wants to come back. If perhaps you could find me some prisoners...[if:convo_thinking][ib:hip]
This action will start a war.
Yes, they are here. Tell your men to come pick them up.
participate in a pilgrimage.
I brought {AMOUNT_TO_DELIVER} {.%}{?AMOUNT_TO_DELIVER > 1}{PLURAL(REQUESTED_GOOD)}{?}{REQUESTED_GOOD}{\?}{.%} as we agreed.
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} has lost {SETTLEMENT} and your agreement with {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} has been canceled.

The noble gave the young adult command of a small group of scouts. {?CHILD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} took them on patrol and even though some were twice {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} age, {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} won their respect.

{QUEST_GIVER.LINK}: Thank you. My lords see the conquest of {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} was a stepping stone toward further victories. {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} is grateful for your service. Because you didn't lead the army, {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} gave you {LESSER_REWARD}{GOLD_ICON} denars.
{RULER.NAME} of the {KINGDOM} has decided to sign a trade agreement with the {OTHER_KINGDOM} despite the opposition of {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.
This is for {COMPANION.NAME}
Trick knife throws and swift evasions can entertain a marketplace crowd, but are useful on the battlefield as well.
Marriage Offer
{SALUTATION_BY_PLAYER}, I wish to be more than a mercenary. Is there a way I could pledge myself as a vassal?
{VALUE}% damage bonus from speed with two handed weapons while on foot.
My liege {QUEST_GIVER.NAME} also instructed me to present you the sum of {REWARD_GOLD}{GOLD_ICON} denars for the prisoners exchange.
Party Type:
Any other questions?
You have failed to pay {TOTAL_DENAR}{GOLD_ICON} denars to {QUEST_GIVER.LINK}. {QUEST_GIVER_VILLAGE} and its locals are aware of your misdemeanor.
Have you made your trip yet? I presume you were able to make a sale?
Let's continue trading with {KINGDOM_NAME}.
{VALUE}% movement speed to infantry in your formation.
I am glad that I found you. Please rejoin my party.
The {FACTION_1} and {FACTION_2} are no longer enemies.
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is not avaliable for this quest anymore.
I'll help if I can.
I am {CONVERSATION_HERO.FIRSTNAME}, a merchant. I trade out of {SETTLEMENT_STRING}. {BUSINESS_STRING}
You're not getting along with the rest of the company. It's better you go.
Sorry. I don't have any animals for you this time.
Excellent... I'm counting on you! The caravan will be leaving soon.[if:convo_normal][ib:hip]

The gang leaders who kept watch over the slums of Calradian cities were always in need of poor youth to run messages and back them up in turf wars, while thrill-seeking merchants' sons and daughters sometimes slummed it in their company as well.
{FIRSTNAME} the Boulder
Target settlement is under attack right now.
Effect of tribute paid from declared
You can not parley during an ongoing battle.
You don't have {BRIBE_COST} denars.
A courier bearing an alliance offer from the {PROPOSER_KINGDOM} has arrived at the court of your realm.
Fah...I don't need more men. Thank you.
It was a pleasure to work with you, chief. Farewell...[if:convo_nonchalant][ib:normal2]
The caravan got lost and it was {CHILD.NAME} who spotted the landmarks that got it back on track.
Honor represents your reputation for respecting your formal commitments, like keeping your word and obeying the law.
He'll be delighted. I'll tell him to join you as soon as possible.
Surrendering bandit parties can be recruited.

{ISSUE_GIVER.LINK} told you that {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} local smith needs {REQUESTED_ITEM} to forge more tools. You asked your companion {COMPANION.LINK} to help the local smith and craft {REQUESTED_ITEM_COUNT} {?(REQUESTED_ITEM_COUNT > 1)}{PLURAL(REQUESTED_ITEM)}{?}{REQUESTED_ITEM}{\?} for the village. Your companion will rejoin your party in {RETURN_DAYS} days.
I just have a minute here, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madame{?}sir{\?}. I need to get back to the loom. How can I help you?
granting villagers the right to graze on land held in common
You declared that the village had paid enough, and departed.
{VALUE}% recovery rate for each type of food in party inventory.
Mounted Patrols
{VALUE}% visual range on the campaign map.
The market isn't what we expected. I am afraid I only made {GATHERED_DENARS}{GOLD_ICON} of the {TOTAL_DENARS}{GOLD_ICON} that we agreed upon.
The rest of your men rushed to your help, dragging you out to safety and driving the bandits back into hiding.
Tell your men as best you can that, while you respect their spirit, this will frighten local farmers who don't understand warriors' ways.
Bow Control
{SALUTATION_BY_PLAYER}, I wish to be released from my oath to you.
{AMOUNT} of your troops got demoted.
I don't wish to speak about that. As you know, our factions are at war.
Good, good. All the best to you, friend.
The {KINGDOM_NAME} was created in {CREATION_YEAR} by {RULER.NAME}, a rising {CULTURE_ADJECTIVE} warlord.
I can offer your realm {GOLD}{GOLD_ICON} to declare war on the {KINGDOM_TO_CALL_TO_WAR_AGAINST}.
{VALUE} relationship with a random lord of your kingdom when an enemy lord is defeated.
Release from homage? Hmm, perhaps it would be for the best... However, {PLAYER.NAME}, you must be sure that release is what you desire. This is not a thing done lightly.
{?PLAYER_CHILD}Your{?}The{\?} child quickly solves problems in {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} head, helping adults with their calculations.
You like that fiery spirit! Let them fight until one falls and cannot rise
Return to siege
trekking around nearby hills.
Choose an Achievement
I will miss this little deal we had. See you at the end
Capture the enemy.
{HERO.NAME} is traveling right now.
{VALUE}% daily chance to get +1 relation with a random notable in the governed settlement while a continuous project is active.
I'll hunt down {TOTAL_COUNT} bands of brigands for you.
Polearm weapon speed: +{a0}%
Declare that you owe your victory to your own right arm, and keep the silver
Let us discuss the final terms of our marriage.
Make peace with the {KINGDOM_NAME}. Our kingdom will pay {T} tribute daily.

{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} asked you to sell {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} goods for at least {UNIT_PRICE}{GOLD_ICON} per load and return to {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}him{\?}. {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} told you that any profit would make above this price is yours to keep.
You failed to complete tournaments in time. {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} will certainly be disappointed.
The {KINGDOM} will stop {POLICY_DESCRIPTION} ({POLICY}). {POLICY_SUPPORT}

You are known as a brave {?PLAYER.GENDER}warrior{?}warrior{\?} and a fine leader of men, {PLAYER.NAME}. I shall be pleased to accept your sword into my service, if you are ready to swear homage to me.
All right, but if this falls through because you took too long, I won't be too happy with that.
Your clan/faction is now at war with {QUEST_GIVER.LINK}'s faction. Your agreement with {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} has been canceled.
Caught Illness
That steel is forged from iron, and long hard marches breed tough warriors.

You must be the nice {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?} who {QUEST_GIVER.NAME} has been telling us about. We have been expecting you. The goods are nearby. I will tell my friends to bring them out as soon as you pay up.
Do you need mercenaries? I have a contract that I can transfer to you for {DEMAND_GOLD} denars.
Well, if they get wind of what you're up to, things could go very wrong for me. Do be quick.[ib:nervous2][if:convo_dismayed]
If you don't want to get involved in this yourself, leave one of your capable companions and {NUMBER_OF_TROOPS} men for some days.[ib:closed][if:convo_grave]
Gripped by wanderlust, {?PLAYER_CHILD}your{?}the{\?} child rode from the freezing woods of Sturgia to the blazing Nahasa.
I would like to assign you a new role.
Carry the bodies with you until you find dry wood or softer ground
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} expects your return to have {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} share of the deal.
{ISSUE_OWNER.LINK} has captured {TARGET_HERO.LINK} {?ISSUE_OWNER.GENDER}herself{?}himself{\?}, your contract with {ISSUE_OWNER.LINK} has canceled.
type of item
Target party is currently in an army right now.
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} has died. Your quest is canceled.
While lacking experience a bit, you are full with youthful energy, you are fully eager, for the long years of adventuring ahead.

The depredations of the {NEARBY_ENEMY_FACTION} has driven many farmers from their homes. Those who have land usually return to it, but many of the poorer are seeking a new place to live. You speak to a few encamped on the outskirts of your village. There is no land for them. They seem eager to work as tenants, but there is always a possibility of tensions with the more established village families.
Good. I count on you.[if:convo_relaxed_happy]
Do not expect mercy. Off with your head!
{SETTLEMENT}{.o} rebels
{VALUE} battle morale against bandit parties.
And I will respect and cherish your family.
That sounds expensive.
a servant of the {FACTION_NAME}
..and I will be at your side to fight your enemies should you need my sword.
led men into enemy territory.

Villagers say that a wanderer has recently arrived and offered to teach their children to read. He is not only well-educated, but he has a gift for holding the attention of restless 10-year-olds. However, he seems to have spent time with one of the rebel bands that were common around here ten years back, and occasionally speaks of a coming reign of justice brought by Heaven, in a way that doesn't seem like one of his ironic jokes.
That will do. You've made a wise choice, my friend. We do well by our loyal fighters, and you can expect worthy rewards for your service.
It is not in my interest to change sides. (Self-interest persuasion failed.)
Faster building production +{a0}%
Partners in Crime
The ruler has a monopoly on certain goods, although practically he can license out production to merchants and collect a portion of the proceeds.
Provides income based on bound village hearts
Owner of {SETTLEMENT_NAME}
Peasant Leader
Seven Veterans
If you can advance to win the tournament, I'm sure that will do us both honor.[ib:hip2][if:convo_relaxed_happy]
Even the finest swordsman can perish if his lord is ignorant of the difference between necessary risks and reckless, unnecessary ones.

Your family numbered among the poor migrants living in the slums that grow up outside the walls of the river cities, making whatever money they could from a variety of odd jobs. Sometimes they did services for one of the region's many criminal gangs.
{ATTRIBUTE1} and {ATTRIBUTE2} are increased by {NUMBER_AP}.
A baron's retainers
{ARMY} has been disbanded. They no longer have any ships to carry the men, and the survivors are heading to shore on makeshift rafts or by clinging to driftwood.
Sorry, not interested.
I yield
{VALUE}% build speed to non-ranged siege engines.
Ok then. I will call my men to help you form a trade convoy. I hope it brings you a good profit.
Hairy {FIRSTNAME}
As your leader I am able to decide the best course of action.
My lord, may you give me another chance to prove myself?
{newline} • Army Gold Gain : {ARMY_GOLD_GAIN}
Hmf. Really?[ib:closed][if:idle_angry]
Rest easy. Your captivity has ended.
Request a parley
Tell him quietly that you will not profit off of the misery of others.
Good Natured
You are about to lose sight of the caravan. Find the caravan before they are in danger!
Thank you, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?}. Your companion will no doubt be very helpful.
{VALUE}% battle morale effect to friendly troops with your two handed kills.
{VALUE}% experience gain for companions.
Small Unit Tactics
Please don't kill us. We surrender.[rf:idle_angry][ib:nervous]
+{EFFECT_AMOUNT}% experience gained to you party from sea battles.
You have sold the mercenaries to another lord as you promised. {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is grateful and sends {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} regards.
{FIRSTNAME} of the Harvest
Let them fight until the first drop of blood is shed
Tell your men that they have all earned the right to your esteem, and break out an extra ration of {FOOD_OR_DRINK_ITEM} to show your appreciation
{newline} • Notable Powers: {NOTABLE_POWER_LOST_AMOUNT}%
Yeah? What is it now?
50% less speed penalty and 15% sight range bonus in forests.
Can I fly my own banner?
{?AMOUNT > 0}Gain{?}Lose{\?} {ABS(AMOUNT)} influence
{VALUE}% recruitment cost of infantry.
You have transferred the recruits to {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} as promised.
Scout {CURRENTLY_HELD_SCOUT}
{VALUE} relationships with lords and ladies for successful crafting orders.
I can't spare anyone now. You will need to go alone.
Remind your men that war is war, the {TROOP_TYPE} knew the risks, and prisoners bring ransoms
Is there anything else?[ib:normal]
{VALUE}% reload speed with crossbows.
I had not thought that I might marry a shieldmaiden. But it is intriguing. Tell me, have you killed men in battle?
Smugglers of {ORIGIN_SETTLEMENT}
Ahoy, you! Keep your distance or our sails will foul.
Tell me about the details.

One of your tenants has a proposal for you. He proposes to dig a channel known as a qanah into a hillside, where the water table is high, which will allow him to flood some low-lying ground and turn it into an oasis garden. The barren hillside is your property, though at present it yields no income of any kind.
I have every reason to believe you'll reach round {ROUND_COUNT}.
{?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} endurance.

As you inspect your siege camp, you come across disgusting evidence that one or more of your men has contracted the bloody flux. It will pass from man to man as they share food and water, and you know what it can do to a besieging army if left unchecked.
Candidly, what do you think of your liege, {FIRST_NAME}?
We Pledge our Swords
10% production bonus to villages that are bound to castles.
I'm {PLAYER.NAME}. Let's skip the pleasantries and get right to business.
Imposing Stature
{?PLAYER_CHILD}Your{?}The{\?} child helps out the local physician, binding and cleaning wounds and, when the master is absent, prescribing remedies.
Great Leader
I still think we may not be ready yet.
To craft a tactic one must first have an idea of what has worked in the past and what has failed, and any commander should know the course and outcome of as many battles as possible.
If you need me, you know where to find me.
Traveling Rumors
{ISSUE_GIVER.NAME} offers you a deal to fix {TOURNAMENT_COUNT} tournaments and share the profit from the bet winnings.
You will have to fight us first![rf:idle_angry][ib:aggressive]
{FIRSTNAME} the Spider
{AMOUNT} of your {?AMOUNT > 1}troops{?}troop{\?} gets wounded
{CHANCE}% chance of {?AMOUNT > 0}gaining{?}losing{\?} {ABS(AMOUNT)} influence
The laws of {ISSUE_GIVER_SETTLEMENT} dictate that artisans sell their goods at a fixed rate to the merchants in town. And now they complain the price set by the merchants is not fair.
I believe it hasn't been long since we've last bartered.
Even the most skilled swordsman or the strongest axe-wielder is to a lancer as the rabbit is to the eagle.
Well Strapped

{PRISONER_LORD.LINK}{?PRISONER_LORD_HAS_FACTION_LINK} of the {PRISONER_LORD_FACTION_LINK}{?}{\?} is now free.
The men say the food's running out. We expect them to die for us if needed. Least we can do is let them die on a full belly.
I see. Maybe we will speak again when I have one.
Thank you, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?} that would be very good. Merchants will not like this but the hard-working artisans like me will be grateful to you for this.
Wait, wait... You're not going anywhere just yet.

{ISSUEGIVER.LINK}, a merchant from {SETTLEMENT}, has told you about {?ISSUEGIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} recent problems with bandits. {?ISSUEGIVER.GENDER}She{?}he{\?} asked you to guard {?ISSUEGIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} caravan for a while and deal with any attackers. In return {?ISSUEGIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} offered you {GOLD}{GOLD_ICON} for each day your troops spend on escort duty.{newline}You agreed to lend {?ISSUEGIVER.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} {NEEDED_MEN_COUNT} men. They should be enough to turn away most of the bandits. Your troops should return after {RETURN_DAYS} days.
So we fight.[if:idle_angry][ib:warrior]
Great. I will be heading out soon.
That's the right call. Thank you for listening to the voice of reason.
Very good. Keep searching. We still need more men.[ib:hip2]
{VALUE}% damage per 100 skill difference with the enemy when troops are sent to confront the enemy.
Hmf. I am amused. So amused that I might have to cut out your tongue after the battle and keep it to remind me of your wit.[if:idle_angry][ib:warrior]
Because if you don't, I'll cut you down right here and now.
Pristine Streets
treats injuries.
letting the ruler collect extra taxes in wartime
{VALUE} experience per day to all troops in party.
You told {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} that it is cheaper, safer and wiser to win a battle without fighting, if it is possible to do so.
Tell them that you believe them to be oathbreakers, and as such have no place in your ranks.
I will have one of my companions take care of this.
The {ENEMY_KINGDOM_INFORMAL_NAME} have occupied our ancestral lands and they oppress our kinfolk.
As you wish.[if:convo_normal][ib:demure]
I'm not interested, thank you.
I will endeavor to treat you as well as I can.

Heroic Leader

I am ready, {LORD.LINK}.
You could never have bought the equipment on your own, but you were a good enough rider so that the local lord lent you a horse and equipment. You joined the armored cavalry, training with the lance.
{ARMY} has been disbanded since a new leader cannot be selected
{VALUE}% daily chance to increase relations with a random notable of same sex in the governed settlement.
What do you want me to do?
The highest ranking of nobles have the de facto right to assemble large armies.
Applaud his plan, and tell him that you will charge him nothing to sink a channel through your property.

Shortly after the loot is distributed, you come across several of your men rubbing the edges of the coins that you paid them against a rock. You recognize what they're doing - clipping, or shaving off a bit of the silver to melt down in the hope that no one will notice.
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} sends {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} regards for a fine job done with the {REWARD}{GOLD_ICON} {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} promised.
{VALUE}% better deals for heroes from ransom brokers.
Wage Limit
Bloody {FIRSTNAME}

Yes. Some of the families in this village need to raise a bit of money. [if:convo_calm_friendly][ib:normal2]They've put together a herd of {ANIMAL_COUNT_TO_DELIVER} {.%}{?ANIMAL_COUNT_TO_DELIVER > 1}{PLURAL(HERD_TYPE_TO_DELIVER)}{?}{HERD_TYPE_TO_DELIVER}{\?}{.%} to sell in {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}, but with all the banditry on the roads, they can't drive it there on their own. We're not merchants or landowners. We can't afford any losses.
{?CHILD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} is at home in the wilderness. {?CHILD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} moves like a cat, and has very keen ears and eyes.
On a second thought... Now is not the right time to do this.
Wrought Iron{@Plural}loads of wrought iron{\@}
rode to the edge of the world.
Donate troops to garrison

Your family had little land of their own, so they earned their living from the woods, hunting and trapping. They taught you from an early age that skills like finding game trails and killing an animal with one shot could make the difference between eating and starvation.
You heard that {CHILD.NAME} could put an arrow through an arm ring from 100 paces away, but you didn't believe it until you saw it.
Effect of unshared wars
{VALUE}% advantage against bandits when troops are sent to confront the enemy.
Caravans are 30% cheaper to build. 10% less trade penalty.
appointing independent elders to uphold the law
Excellent. I'll have the goods delivered to you right away.[if:convo_nonchalant]
Then why are you here? We're not the sort who does business on credit. Come back when you have the money.
I wish to form a trade convoy in this town.
I don't like running away from a battle like that.

One thing - if one or two die, that's the fortunes of war, things could go even worse if we get raided and have no one who can fight back... But try not to get them all massacred. These men will take some risks for me, but not have their lives thrown away to no purpose.[if:convo_stern]
{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} will pay you {REWARD_GOLD}{GOLD_ICON} denars when the task is done.
{?CHILD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} won a friendly horse racing competition, and was rewarded with a magnificent saddle.
You got rid of the smugglers as you promised {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} you would do.
You have lost the battle against the mercenaries. You have failed to get rid of them as you promised. Now they've turned bandit and are starting to plunder the countryside
I will buy the livestock from you for {TOTAL_GOLD}{GOLD_ICON}. This way we both will get what we desire.
While you are resting, you hear news that a force led by {ATTACKER} has arrived outside of {DEFENDER} to raid it.
Not yet. I have some other business to attend to.

A courier arrives, bearing a message from {OFFERED_KINGDOM_LEADER.NAME}. {?OFFERED_KINGDOM_LEADER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} remarks on your growing reputation, and asks if you would consider pledging yourself as a vassal of the {OFFERED_KINGDOM_NAME}. You should speak in person if you are interested.
a sharp mind.
Hope you're keeping safe. You never know who's lurking about.
Noble Retinues
I don’t want no confrontation with you.
You betrayed the gang leader and refused the {MERCHANT.LINK}'s request. The goods stayed with you.
{VALUE}% costs of recruiting minor faction clans into your clan.
Fortune favors the bold. With you with us, we will win this war quickly.
So be it. Come see me again if you want to arrange a new one.
Very well. I'm going to need about {GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} to settle up some debts, though. Can you pay?
You best let us be. There's dozens more of us hiding here, just waiting for our signal.
I had expected better of you. But even the best can fail sometimes. Just make sure it does not happen again.[if:convo_bored][ib:closed2]
Effects village's hearth.
{VALUE}% swing speed with polearms.

Well... Thank you very much. I am grateful.

Your clerk at your {WORKSHOP} in {TOWN} has caught one of your foremen skimming from the funds you use to purchase raw materials. Luckily, he did not take much, and he readily confessed. How do you prevent this from happening in the future?
Controlled Smith
burnished {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} social skills.
Army Dispersed
I would prefer it if you attended to this yourself. But if you have any companions who can handle a force of {REQUIRED_TROOP_AMOUNT} men, one of them can take care of it.
You persuaded the smugglers to move away from {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}. They are now far away from {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} and {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is satisfied.

All of Calradia's kingdoms recognize the value of good light cavalry and horse archers, and are sure to recruit nomads and borderers with the skills to fulfill those duties. You were a good enough rider that your neighbors pitched in to buy you a small pony and a good bow so that you could fulfill their levy obligations.
All I can say is that I try to repay good with good, and evil with evil.

{CAPTIVITY_TEXT}{newline}Waiting in captivity...

You hear talk of incriminating letters and loose tongues paid to stay silent. You're not sure exactly what happened, but {?PLAYER_CHILD}your{?}the{\?} child seems more worldly than {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} did when {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} left.
not to be too choosy about travelling companions.

Join {FACTION}

One other small thing... I've had to take some money from some fairly dangerous people around here. I'll need {GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} to get that beast off my back. Do you reckon you can pay me that?
You're doing a good thing, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madame{?}sir{\?}. The poor people around here will remember you

{?PLAYER.GENDER}Ma'am{?}Sir{\?}! I saw your party from a distance. I hope you don't mind me catching up to you. I am glad to see you safe - and, from the looks of it, in possession of some fine new goods. Please tell me, would they be mine?

{QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is a {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?} who told you that {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} wants to sell {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} mercenaries to another lord's service. {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} asked you sell them for {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} without causing any trouble.
About the task {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} gave me...

20% less tax income from towns.

{AGGRESSOR_RULER.NAME} of the {AGGRESSOR_KINGDOM} chose not to go to war with the {KINGDOM} with the support of {?AGGRESSOR_RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.
Tell {NOTABLE.NAME} that you will write whatever {?NOTABLE.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} wants, for the proper price.
We're just harmless shepherds...

Tactical Mastery
I'm sure your lieutenant will solve my problem. Thank you for your help.[if:convo_nonchalant][ib:demure2]
Good. We will be heading out soon.
So, captain. We expect a bit of looting and plundering as compensation, in addition to the wages. You don't seem like you're going to provide it to us. So, farewell.[if:innocent_smile][ib:hip]

We heard you wish to issue a decree changing our longstanding rules on pricing. Of course this is your right, but I'd like to remind you that we merchants pay significantly more taxes than the artisans. I would ask you to think of the finances of the town, and reconsider this.
{FIRSTNAME} the {?FEMALE}Widow{?}Orphan{\?}

Tell her, as soberly as you can, that her husband gave his life for a noble cause. Hand her a purse of 100 denars, and tell her that you are sure that he would be happy if she marries again, as long as he remains in her memory.
My thanks. It feels good to be {?PLAYER.GENDER}free{?}a free man{\?} once again.
Enter the Village
Your fleet is not here!
I was just jesting. I need you more than ever. Now go back to your job.
Moving to the nearest shore.
It's secret. You must be new in your post if you don't know who I am and what I do.
Oh there will be one, all right.[if:convo_predatory][ib:warrior]
If you have work for me, we could discuss it.
You know me. I'll be careful not to get this get back to the wrong ears.
You have collected enough grains that the army commander requested. Return to army and deliver the supplies
Forgive me {?CONVERSATION_NPC.GENDER}madame{?}sir{\?}. I don't know what I was thinking.
Make Them Pay
But I have one with you, pirate! Give up now.
Settlement Buildings
Early Childhood

I'm of a mind to send out a new caravan but I fear it will be plundered before it can turn a profit. So I am looking for some good fighters who can escort it until it finds its footing and visits a couple of settlements.
You best back off. There's dozens more of us hiding, just waiting for our signal.
{CHANCE}% chance of {?AMOUNT > 0}increasing{?}decreasing{\?} relationship with notables in {SETTLEMENT} by {ABS(AMOUNT)}
Your clan is now at war with the {ISSUE_GIVER.LINK}'s lord. Your agreement with {ISSUE_GIVER.LINK} was canceled.

As you ride off, a villager runs after you accusing one of your men of stealing a rooster. A few squawks silence the culprit's attempt to deny the crime. Honor requires you to uphold the laws of the land, but your men expect a generous {RANK} to value those who shed blood for {PRONOUN} over those who do not.
Attack the blockade to help the defenders
Very well. Follow us.
Good day to you.
Maximum Auto Recruitment
All right. It's good to be back.
{VALUE}% combat movement speed while no weapons or shields are equipped.
{RULER.NAME} chose not to expel the {CLAN} clan from the {KINGDOM} over the objections of {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.
{?AMOUNT > 0}Heal{?}Lose{\?} {ABS(AMOUNT)} hit points
So it seems as though {ENEMY_NAME} have had enough of war. Good. Peace is good.
What kind of skill is this, speaking broadly? What trait would you say it reflects?
The Art of the Trade
{VALUE}% crossbow damage to mounts.
Fah... I don't need more men. Thank you.
It was a pleasure, sir. I hope to see you again some time soon.

{DEFAULT_TEXT}Before {?ARMY_LEADER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} fell, {ARMY_LEADER.LINK} granted {?ARMY_LEADER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} men their customary right of pillage after a successful siege. They may take property but must spare the townsfolk's lives.
Haunted Dreams

As you prepare to leave the village, the elder approaches you. His nephew is to be married, and it would be a great honor if a warrior of your renown would bless the couple. Your men suppress grins and jostle each other, and you know they are looking forward to the chance to get royally drunk.

Your family's clan never pledged its loyalty to the khan and never settled down, preferring to live out in the deep steppe away from his authority. They remain some of the finest trackers and scouts in the grasslands, as the ability to spot an enemy coming and move quickly is often all that protects their herds from their neighbors' predations.

You told your men to ignore the warning. Several hours after you left, some of your men started experiencing chills, then diarrhea. This does not appear to be a particularly virulent strain, as no one died, but about half your men are incapacitated.
Just hand over the money to make the problem go away.
Very well. This is a great step to take, but it must be done.[if:convo_calm_friendly][ib:confident]

I've been studying a lot, {?PLAYER.GENDER}my lady{?}lord{\?}. The manuscripts I've acquired on the way on various subjects are invaluable. Seeing professionals in action complements the theoretical knowledge I've learned from the manuscripts.[if:convo_calm_friendly][ib:demure2]
You have cleared the hideout. Your men found the {.%}{?(STOLEN_GOODS_SIZE > 1)}{PLURAL(STOLEN_GOOD)}{?}{STOLEN_GOOD}{\?}{.%} stashed nearby.
{WORKSHOP} {?PERCENTAGE > 0}gained{?}lost{\?} {AMOUNT} gold.
Siege Workshop
The young {?CHILD.GENDER}woman{?}man{\?} pursued enemy scouts while avoiding their main force. There was little fighting but a great deal of riding.
{RULER.NAME} has decided against giving {SETTLEMENT} to a new clan over the objections of {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.
{VALUE}% damage by troops in your formation.
The cruelty of {CURRENT_LIEGE.NAME} is legendary. Who cares what he stands for if the realm is drenched in blood?
We do not need hired swords to win this war. You should seek your fortune elsewhere.

Do you want to buy the goods yourself? Or will I retain ownership, and you just keep the extra profits? I am expecting to earn {TOTAL_DENARS}{GOLD_ICON} for {SELECTED_COUNT} loads of produce. If would like to buy it right away you can simply sell it yourself or do whatever you wish with it.
Disavow {POLICY_NAME}
Sure, boss. It will cost us {COST}{GOLD_ICON} for new equipment. Shall we go ahead?
{VALUE}% disorganized state duration when a raid or siege is broken.
There are some townspeople who've looked after me here, made sure I was fed and that. I'd like to give them something before I go. Could I ask for {GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} as an advance?
Thank you for your help, {PLAYER.NAME}. Here is the purse I promised you. Farewell.[if:convo_happy][ib:hip]
{VALUE} daily experience to foot troops while traveling.
Long Reach
We recently lost our leader, now we are traveling to {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}. We will rejoin the garrison unless we are assigned a new leader.
Thank you. You will be rewarded when you are done.[if:convo_mocking_aristocratic]
Collected Items
Excellent! I knew you were an honest soul. Trust is a fine thing, isn't it? Perhaps we can do more business in the future.[if:convo_innocent_smile][ib:confident]

I think the reason we have it so bad here is because one gang in particular has good contacts both in {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} and in {ORIGIN_SETTLEMENT}. They've so far managed to elude me, but if you patrol the area between the two cities, you might have better luck. And look - I'd prefer it if you brought them to justice, but if you can persuade them to move elsewhere, I'd settle for that too.

Only loyal vassals of {FACTION_LEADER} can own lands and castles. You understand, a simple mercenary cannot be trusted with such responsibility. However, after serving for some time, you may earn the right to swear homage to {FACTION_LEADER} and become his vassal. Then you would be rewarded with a fief.
No morale penalty for recruiting prisoners of your faction.
Great. Going to need some money in advance though - {GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON}. Can you pay?
You were sent by the village healer up into the hills to look for useful medicinal plants. You learned which herbs healed wounds or brought down a fever, and how to find them.
Ah, yes. My efforts are currently focused on this campaign, so it's best we discuss your proposal at a later time.
Debasement Of The Currency
Some nobles may consider it vulgar and common, but the art of acrobatics is demanding and often has very practical applications.
I must leave now.
{CHANCE}% chance of increasing reputation for being {TRAIT}
Refuse, knowing that separate rituals will breed suspicion among the different cultures in your ranks
{VALUE} persuasion success required against characters of your own culture.
procured supplies.
dealing with business partners.

We do have a problem. Last winter was hard on our animals. A number died from disease, and others were taken by wolves. We'd go to town to buy more, but, well, herds make a tempting target for bandits and we're not really suited to fight them. We can't afford to slaughter even the oldest and weakest of our animals because we need them to pull the plough. Maybe you can help us?[if:convo_grave][ib:demure2]
{LORD.FIRSTNAME} is a member of the {CLAN_NAME}, {CLAN_DESCRIPTION} from the lands of the {FACTION_NAME}. {?LORD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} has the reputation of being {REPUTATION}.
Only a faction leader can grant vassalhood. Your relationship with that leader must be at least {RELATION} and you need a Clan Tier of {TIER}.
joined a pilgrimage.
Whatever oath I give to you, you may be sure that I will keep it.
Do you have any general thoughts on politics?
Certainly. What do you need to know?
Your fleet has disbanded, as you no longer have a flagship with which to lead it.
{FIRSTNAME} the Anvil

Splendid. My men will guide your companion to the hideout.
Singing for Supper

What an exciting result! I will definitely miss these tournaments. Well, maybe after some time goes by and memories get a little hazy we can continue. Here is the last payment. Very well deserved.[if:convo_happy][ib:demure]
Deserters have noticed our presence, they are running away!
{AGGRESSOR_RULER.NAME} of the {AGGRESSOR_KINGDOM} chose not to go to war with the {KINGDOM}.

Force notables to give you recruits.
restricting what creditor may do to collect debts

One of your men comes up to you excitedly. A peddler in the marketplace sold him a map to a treasure buried by a long-dead Kannic sorceror in a wadi near here. He wants a bit of time to check it out and promises you a fifth share of anything he finds. You've heard tales of gold found in ancient tombs near here, but in this case you'd give a hundred to one odds that this leads to either a grave that was pillaged centuries ago or someone's underground irrigation cistern, and at any rate the locals won't appreciate your man smashing things up with pick and shovel.

Yes... As you know, the wars this realm has fought have been very costly. The great lords in particular are hard-put to raise the armies that are key to this land's defense. Some of us have proposed increasing the hearth taxes paid by the peasantry, which is a key source of revenue. I don't know if this law will be approved, but rumors of it have gotten out in my district, and a lot of the farmers are restless. Now, most of us are doing their part to keep a lid on things. But there's one, {MALE_LESSER_NOBLE_NAME}, who I am ashamed to say was once a {TOP_TIER_CAV_TITLE} under my banner, who's been going around the countryside, stirring up trouble. He's gathered a following and they have a whole list of demands, including a ban on new taxes, that would frankly cripple our realm's ability to raise the money needed to defend itself. I'd take care of him myself, but that wouldn't look good. Maybe you can help?[if:convo_thinking][ib:closed2]
{VALUE}% chance for dealing double damage to besieging troops in siege bombardment of the governed settlement.
Have you already sold that {SELECTED_ITEM}? If so, that seems awfully quick.
I just don't think that we would be happy together.

Not that I can think of. But if you don't want to do it, you can nominate someone from your party. It's not going to be easy, though. Whoever you name should be a good leader and have a good knowledge of tactics, and should take along at least {ALTERNATIVE_SOLUTION_NEEDED_MAN_COUNT} men. I'm ready to pay {REWARD}{GOLD_ICON} for your service. And if it comes to a fight, you can take whatever loot you want as spoils of war.[if:convo_thinking]
Perhaps, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?}, it was a mistake? If you were to relinquish the goods, it would avoid a situation that might appear, well, a bit unseemly.
The client is displeased.

You recruited the bandits who were giving {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} trouble. {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} is satisfied with this outcome, and sends you {REWARD_GOLD}{GOLD_ICON} that {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} promised.

They should return with the reward of {GOLD_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} denars as promised by {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} after dealing with them in {RETURN_DAYS} days.
Sadly bid farewell to the migrants and wish them well in future endeavors.

never back down from a challenge.

A pleasure to have met you.

That is an outrage! You can't treat your prisoners this way! All the other lords will hate your guts for it. And my family will never forget this!

As you leave {VILLAGE_NAME}, a woman approaches you and grasps your horse's halter. Among your prisoners is her son, she says. You captured him when he was part of a gang of bandits, but she tells you tearfully that he is a good boy who fell in with bad company. She swears she'll ensure that he doesn't stray again from the correct path.
The best blows are struck not to the body but to the spirit. Let the defenders know you found it by diverting it to a pool where your men can bathe on the hottest, thirstiest days of the siege.
Have you brought our supplies?

{ISSUE_GIVER.LINK} {?ISSUE_GIVER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?} of {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} told you that {?ISSUE_GIVER.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} has been having issues with smugglers running between {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} and {ORIGIN_SETTLEMENT}. You decided to send {COMPANION.LINK} with {TROOP_COUNT} men to find the smugglers. They should return after {RETURN_DAYS} days.
I think that's enough. Here is your payment.

We do have some problems. [ib:demure][if:convo_dismayed] A sickness passed through here last month. Praise the Heavens, only a few people died, but many were weakened and we couldn't get much work done. Now we need to hire some laborers from nearby settlements to make up the shortfall, but we don't have the tools for them. We're in a bit of a rush - do you think you could find tools for us?
{HERO.NAME} is a governor.
You can only transfer {X} prisoner{?IS_PLURAL}s{?}{\?}.
Honor the Slain Foe
I don't think we'll have any more problems at {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}, thanks to your men. Please give them our thanks, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madam{?}sir{\?}.[if:convo_mocking_teasing][ib:hip]

All towns had their share of projects that were constantly in need of both skilled and unskilled labor. You learned how hoists and scaffolds were constructed, how planks and stones were hewn and fitted, and other skills.
{VICTIM.NAME} has died in battle.
served as a baron's groom.
All supporters gains some relation with the supported candidate clan and might lose with the others.
authorizing the ruler to have a large private bodyguard
Your family were respected physicians in an oasis town. They set bones and cured the sick, and their skills were in much demand. They were respected in the higher echelons of society too.
Your men's wages are late. That's not the kind of company I like to fight in.
So... I'm glad to have the chance to spend some time together.
Good, good. This takes time, I know, but don't keep me waiting too long.[if:convo_mocking_aristocratic]
No, we are doing fine.

As you leave town, one of your cavalrymen finds his mount lying on the ground, whining in pain and refusing to get up. You're sure that he was careless and fed the animal too quickly after your arrival, as he was eager to get to the town's tavern.
Indulge your man, and wait for his to complete his errand
The enemy no longer holds any villages. {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} has canceled your mission.
Well Built
You are just a bunch of hunters. You don't stand a chance against us!

You told the artisan to make sure that {?PLAYER_CHILD}your{?}the{\?} child works hard, and that {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} swings the hammer for hours in the blazing heat of the forge. It tempers the soul, you believe.

You need to be the {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?} of this settlement.

Break out your food and allow them to fill their bellies before your depart

Thank you, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madam{?}sir{\?}. Any brigands would be most unwise to tangle with you.

{FACTION_LEADER} will decide if the {KINGDOM_CONSIDERING_PEACE_NAME} will make peace with the {KINGDOM_NAME} by paying {TRIBUTE_PERCENTAGE} percent of the kingdom's income as tribute. You can pick your stance regarding this decision.

As you leave town, a merchant approaches you. He shows you a document indicating that one of your {TROOP_TYPE} took out a loan, to be repaid on departure with a quarter part as interest. Your man shrugs, calls the merchant a thief for loaning at such ruinous rates, and says he lost the money gambling anyway.
Flee while you can. An army is already on its way here to hang you all.
You cannot enter arena while in disguise.

You told the notable that this was not your affair. A few hours later, the mutineers ambushed and killed some of your men on the outskirts of the village, and the revenues stolen. Your men completed collecting revenues from the village, but lost it all to an ambush.

Every well-born youth wants to see the center of it all, where the lords and ladies gather in splendor to converse and connive. You invited the child to see the spectacle first hand, and provided the elegant clothes {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?}'d need to be part of it.
worked in the village smithy.

We are about to go on campaign but my quartermaster reports that our food supplies will not be enough to keep us in the field for very long. I can't spare any of my lords, so I need someone else to bring us a large amount of supplies as soon as possible. Can you do this?[if:convo_grave][ib:closed]
Yes. That is a lot but yes I can pay that. Thank you {?PLAYER.GENDER}milady{?}my Lord{\?}. I knew we could reach an agreement.[if:convo_grateful][ib:confident]
I don't mind, brigand. Surrender or die!
When a sudden storm caused the local stream to rise suddenly, your neighbors needed quick-thinking leadership. You provided it, directing them to build levees to save their homes.
Did you ever find a way to handle those mercenaries?[if:convo_astonished]

As the highest tactics skilled member {HIGHEST_TACTICS_SKILLED_MEMBER} ({HIGHEST_TACTICS_SKILL}) devise a plan to disperse into the wilderness to break away from your enemies. a treatise on siegecraft.

learn the arts of healing.

You can assign a companion with {REQUIRED_SOLDIERS} men, they will be enough too. Both ways works fine for us. I promise if you or your men manage to deliver the herd safely, I will pay you {REWARD}{GOLD_ICON}. So what do you say?[if:convo_nonchalant]

Their lords will need to chase the raiders and won't be able to threaten us elsewhere. You seem to be the right {?PLAYER.GENDER}warrior{?}man{\?} for the job. What do you say? You'll have my gratitude and you'll be well rewarded if you succeed.

As you pass through the town gates, you are thronged by a group of refugees from the countryside. They are gaunt, with sunken eyes. They say they were unable to sow their fields this year for fear of bandits, and were forced to eat their seed grain. They ask for any scraps you can offer.
Is there anything else I can do it for you?
So it shall be proclaimed throughout your domain. May {KINGDOM_NAME} forever be victorious!

Well.. There are many goods around the town that can bring good money if you trade them. A caravan you formed will do this for you. You need to pay at least {AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} to hire caravan guards to form a caravan and you need one companion to lead the caravan guards.

You know next to nothing about the lad, although {NOTABLE.NAME} swears that he is honest and conscientious. You find you are receiving a number of these types of requests as your fame spreads.

This was not we were expecting. We lost some money. Well, Lady Fortune always casts her ballot too in these contests. But try to reassure us that this was her plan, and not yours, eh?[if:convo_grave][ib:closed2]

As you leave {VILLAGE_NAME}, several of the villagers approach you. They warn you that stagnant ponds from the last rain have yet to fully dry and have bred mosquitos. Things are getting a bit rough around these parts. I have some lads who help me out with local troublemakers, but they wouldn't last long against real warriors. Maybe you could take them out, show them what actual war is about. I'm not expecting you to make them fit for a noble's retinue, but at least I want to give the bandits around here some pause for thought.[if:convo_bored][ib:closed]

As you move through the streets, you hear whispers of an upcoming war between your faction and {SETTLEMENT_FACTION}. Upon hearing this, you slink away without attracting any suspicion.

Yours wasn't the kind of reputation that local legends are made of, but it was the kind that wins you respect among those around you. You were consistently fair and honest in your business dealings and helpful to those in trouble. In doing so, you got a sense of what made people tick.
Farewell. I wish you fair winds and following seas.
Call the {CALLED_KINGDOM} to War Against the {KINGDOM_TO_CALL_TO_WAR_AGAINST}.

Most children around you had only the most rudimentary education, but you lingered after class to study letters and mathematics. You were fascinated by the marketplace - weights and measures, tallies and accounts, the chatter about profits and losses.

Maybe it was a love affair, or maybe you cheated at dice, or maybe you just chose your words poorly when drinking with a dangerous crowd. Anyway, on one of your trips into town you got into the kind of trouble from which only a quick tongue or quick feet get you out alive.

do some honest work.

Yes, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?}. It is good of you to ask. A group of deserters is camped out near here. They come every few weeks, demanding food and money. They've killed two villagers who resisted them.[if:convo_stern][ib:closed]

In hot climes, often the most vulnerable part of a fortress is its water supply. Most depend on wells but those can run dry. After days spent in front of {FORTRESS_NAME}, you've caught glimpses of the defenders slipping into the hills. You explore where they've gone, and eventually you come across a rudimentary cistern. You suspect that they must be refreshing their water here.

I can designate you as my official revenue farmer, and give you a list of everyone's holdings and how much they owe. All you need to do is visit all my villages and collect what you can. Hmm... Only loyal vassals of {FACTION_LEADER} can own lands and castles. While kings will sometimes accept vassalage from men who prove themselves in battle, and grant them land, I have never heard of a king who gave fiefs to women. You had best discuss that issue with {FACTION_LEADER} himself.

If the wolf pup gang of your early childhood had an alpha, it was definitely you. All the other kids followed your lead as you decided what to play and where to play, and led them in games and mischief.

Your troops are taking a bit longer than usual to get ready, and you've had time to relax a bit and watch goings-on at the market. One commodity vendor in particular has caught your attention. He always uses one set of weights for the sacks that he is buying from local farmers, and another for goods that he sells. You have little doubt that one or both of these sets is a false measure, allowing him to defraud his customers.
Ah. In that case, there is little I can do, unless you have some further argument to make.
Your hometown was briefly placed under siege, and you were called to defend the walls. Everyone did their part to repulse the enemy assault, and everyone is justly proud of what they endured.
Seize the nomads' herds to compensate you and your tenants for their crops.

Leave {SETTLEMENT}.

I accept you as my sworn follower. You shall have the warrior's due: the warmth of my hearthfire and the bread of my fields, and gold for your valor. I shall uphold your rights under the Law of the Sturgians and avenge your blood if you fall.

recognizing the formal inheritance of fiefs

Landowners could often assert legal rights to common areas and charge villages money to use them. If ordinary people petitioned a ruler, however, he might give them the right to use all common areas for hunting or grazing as members of the village.

Your men spot several deer on the outskirts of the village, a rare thing in a land where meat and hides are valuable. The villagers tell you that there was an unusual crop of acorns this year, while fear of bandits has prevented them from hunting as they normally would. They invite you to shoot a few deer, as there will be plenty to go around anyway and the beasts are trampling the crops.
Clans that own a settlement are not considered as mercenaries.

As you leave the village, a trader comes up to you and says the "silver" denars that some of your men just gave him are just polished iron. You can indeed see some specks of rust. He demands that you pay him in full. It's entirely possible that your men tried to pass off some false coinage, but the trader's "evidence" could equally easily have come from his own stock.

I don't know if you know much about the law here... Craftsmen like me are required to buy our raw materials from local merchants. The other side of the bargain is that they offer us reasonable prices. But they're not doing that! They've come together and agreed on a price that's just too high. They don't care if it ruins us - they can always sell the goods elsewhere.[ib:hip][if:convo_thinking]

trains really hard.

After the battle, one of your {TROOPS} from your party approaches you, dreamed of riding with your cavalry as a {NOBLE_TIER}. Throughout your visit to {VILLAGE}, the villagers were worried that the enemy who sacked {LOOTED_VILLAGE} might be sending patrols their way. As you leave, you find out that their fears were not misplaced. The first thing you see is a flight of ravens in the sky. Your men begin to mutter to themselves, but soon they stumble across a sight that silences them - a pile of burned corpses, stacked by a crossroad, left by the {ENEMY} as their calling card. You press on, but you soon notice that your men are casting an eye towards your prisoners. They may not have been directly involved in what happened in {LOOTED_VILLAGE}, but you doubt your men care much.

I've got a trick up my sleeve. We'll bait them. I've paid some of my workers to spread rumors about a particularly fat caravan laden with silverware heading out towards {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}. Stay at a proper distance, until they are attacked. Then move in to finish the bandits once and for all. I need someone to ride along with my herdsmen and my cattle can graze, one way or the other, even if it means violence. I can't let my herd just starve.[if:convo_bored][ib:hip]
People will believe a noble's former servant. This man's favor is worth a purse of silver to you.
You could stop them with a decree, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?}. All the craftsmen here would be very grateful.
Thank you, my {?PLAYER.GENDER}lady{?}lord{\?}. I knew we could reach an agreement.

Yeah... I've got some problems. A few years ago, I needed hides for my tannery and I hired some hunters. I didn't ask too many questions about where they came by the skins they sold me. Your men fought truly heroically in the last battle. As they help their wounded comrades back to camp and gather the slain, their weary faces sometimes look to you with expectation. If ever there was a time to give them some extra recognition of their valor and sacrifice, this would be it.
Give them sufficient money to replace their seed grain, even though the townspeople may complain that it raises prices

Your family needed someone trustworthy to take a caravan to a neighboring town. You organized supplies, ensured a constant watch to keep away bandits, and brought it safely to its destination.

You take a quick look over your men before you ride out, and you are shocked to notice the state of their equipment. In particular, several of the men have frayed bridles and shield straps that look like they might snap in battle. They are supposed to oil and replace their leather at their own expense, and clearly have not been doing so.

Outside events also intruded on {CHILD.NAME}'s adolescence. You believe {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} was particularly shaped by {RANDOM_OUTCOME}. This event increased {?CHILD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} skills in {SKILL_1} and {SKILL_2}.
Agree with the villagers that nomads are more trouble than they are worth.
Leave the village, telling the villagers that they are exempted from payment this year.

{LORD.NAME} is {TITLE} of the {FACTION_NAME} and head of the {CLAN_NAME}, {CLAN_DESCRIPTION} that is backing {RULER} in the civil war. {?LORD.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} has the reputation of being {REPUTATION}.
Recruiting and upgrading mounted troops are 10% cheaper.

You were quick on your feet and attentive to what was going on around you. Usually you could run away from trouble, though you could give a good account of yourself in a fight with other children if cornered.

Your family numbered among the many poor migrants living in the slums that grow up outside the walls of imperial cities, making whatever money they could from a variety of odd jobs. Sometimes they did service for one of the Empire's many criminal gangs, and you had an early look at the dark side of life.

Agalea has never been recognized as a saint by the imperial Senate, and many consider her veneration to be a primitive Palaic holder. Her festivals tend to be rather raucous, befitting the theme of fertility, and also rather expensive. It would certainly set tongues wagging in the district. Do you grant permission?

The language and laws of {CULTURE_NAME}.
You asked {COMPANION.LINK} to deliver at least {WANTED_PRISONER_AMOUNT} prisoners to {ISSUE_GIVER.LINK} in {SETTLEMENT}. They should rejoin your party in {RETURN_DAYS} days.
{RULER.NAME} has decided not to call the {CALLED_KINGDOM} to war against the {KINGDOM_TO_CALL_TO_WAR_AGAINST}. The decision went against the advice of {?RULER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} council.

You don't have enough grain.

As you prepare to leave, the village elder approaches you. There's a gang of four lads who are constantly picking fights with the other villagers, he says. Even their own families don't want them around for fear they'll end up killing someone and cause a blood feud. He begs you to take them into your ranks, where they can learn a bit of discipline.
I don't think so.
Local Connection

an outbreak of plague

My own hand.

This action may start a war.

The letter of the contract would favor the wealthier partner. Merchants should be careful what they sign.

They skin their beasts in the woods, then go into the village after midnight to stash the hides. The villagers are terrified of them, I believe. If you go into the village late at night, you should be able to track them down.[ib:normal][if:convo_thinking]

trade goods

I have every reason to believe you'll win the tournament.

Thank you for your help, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madam{?}sir{\?}. Here is what we promised.

Local wise man picked you to become the messenger of a chieftain of your people. You were not given major responsibilities - mostly carrying messages and tending to his horse - but it did give you a chance to see how campaigns were planned and men were deployed in battle.
Very good, then. Be on your way.
{HERO.NAME} has devastated {SETTLEMENT}.
I am {CONVERSATION_HERO.FIRSTNAME}, {FACTION_DESCRIPTION}. I have come here to share some fragments of the wisdom of the {DIVINITY} that I have been blessed with understanding.
The {CALLED_KINGDOM} is at war with the {KINGDOM_NAME} already.
Back taxes

Grain will solve our problems. If we had {GRAIN_AMOUNT} bushels, we could use it to sow our fields. But I doubt that {NEARBY_TOWN} has so much to sell at this time of the year. {GRAIN_AMOUNT} bushels of grain costs around {DENAR_AMOUNT}{GOLD_ICON} in the markets, and we don't have that![if:convo_thinking]

You were always drawn to animals, and spent as much time as possible hanging out in the village stables. You could calm horses, and were sometimes called upon to break in new colts. You learned the basics of veterinary arts, much of which is applicable to humans as well.
{VALUE}% chance of increasing the siege bombardment casualties per hit by 1.
Perhaps we should discuss a future together...
Picked Shots
No governor

Well, if you know how to fight... Yes, we could use help. A group of deserters is camped out near here. They come every few weeks, demanding food and money. They've killed two villagers who resisted them. We asked our {?LORD.GENDER}mistress{?}lord{\?}, {LORD.NAME}, for help but {?LORD.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} men never get here in time.[if:convo_stern][ib:closed]
Chastise your man for being so gullible
Gained {AMOUNT} renown.
{AMOUNT} of your troops died.
Good. Let's see if we can work out fair compensation for us protecting the roads.
Well, {PLAYER.NAME}. Are you here about that offer I made? Seeing as what's happened between then and now, surely you realize that that offer no longer stands?
Yes of course. It was a pleasure doing business with you.[if:convo_mocking_aristocratic]

One of your cavalry commanders reported that some horses seem mysteriously weak. You see their listless eyes and swollen bellies and recognize it - swamp fever. This plague is spread by horseflies, and it will infect other animals if the horse is not killed

As you are leaving your fief you stumble across an altercation. A group of nomads, who pass by annually on their migration from summer to winter pastures, have allowed their herds to graze in your tenants' crops. Your troops far outnumber the nomads and your tenants are urging you to teach them a lesson, but of course their kin might retaliate at a later date.
We have too many enemies. We need to make peace with at least some of them.
You are going too far. The {KINGDOM} won't stand for the destruction of its caravans.

As you enter the village, some of your men tell you that they've found a group of what look like wild apple trees in full bloom by a stream. They'd fetch a fine price in the village market. Also, here at the arena, we think a lot about the arts of war - and many other related skills as well. Often you pick up certain habits while learning your skills. If you need to change those, to practice one of your skills in a certain way, we can help you.
Sieges required tools, oil, good quality timber and, of course, food. It was young {?CHILD.GENDER}woman{?}man{\?}'s responsibility to have them gathered, stocked and distributed.

Our war with the {TARGET_SETTLEMENT_FACTION_INFORMAL_NAME} is going well enough. But there are some who say that we don't have enough to show for all the blood and silver we've spent. A clear victory at this stage would do a lot of good. I think I would like to see our banner flying from the towers of {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}.[ib:normal2][if:convo_thinking]

Thank you. Your help is much appreciated.

Yes. It's about the war with the {ENEMYFACTION_INFORMALNAME}. [ib:closed][if:convo_pondering]We need to tie up some of their forces, and the easiest way to do that would be to raid their villages. It's a cruel business and will be hard on the common folk, but their lords will need to chase the raiders and it will prevent them from doing the same to us. I can use someone like you in my company.

Your family arranged for you to accompany an envoy. You were not given major responsibilities - mostly carrying arms and trying to look imposing. - but it did give you a chance to travel a lot and socialise and see the world.

Your family came from one of the merchant clans that dominated the cities in eastern Calradia before the Khuzait conquest. They adjusted quickly to their new masters, keeping the caravan routes running and ensuring that the tariff revenues that once went into imperial coffers now flowed to the khanate.
I wish to end our arrangement.

Our pay has been arriving on time, so rest assured that we've got your back.

It is time to bury your dead, but the ground is frozen solid and the wood from nearby trees is too wet to make a proper pyre. You can give the bodies a hasty burial in a nearby gully, even though wolves or other animals may find them, or take the bodies with you to bury them as soon as you can.
{PRISONER_LORD.LINK}{?PRISONER_LORD_HAS_FACTION_LINK} of the {PRISONER_LORD_FACTION_LINK}{?}{\?} has been taken prisoner by the {CAPTOR_FACTION}.

Is in Kingdom
your attention to detail.
End the animal's misery quickly, and tell the horseman that you will not trust another poor beast to his care.
You are the shield of our people against the wolves of the forest, the steppe and the sea.
One of your parties has lost its leader. It will disband after a day has passed. You can assign a new clan member to lead it, if you wish to keep the party.

Now my boys are all trussed up, and these treacherous animals aim to turn them in for the bounty.[if:convo_annoyed][ib:closed]

You've been studying the walls of {FORTRESS_NAME} for days, and you see what appears to be a crack in one place - possibly the result of an old earthquake, or just negligence. It's hard to hit with your catapults and the ground is too rocky to mine, but you reckon troops with pickaxes by themselves could bring it down - assuming they were willing to brave the storm of arrows and rocks that would no doubt come pouring from the battlements above.
Erupt in fury, telling the inspector that there is no way you will be fleeced in this way, legally or illegally.

We don't know enough about the enemy, [ib:closed][if:convo_thinking]where they are strong and where they are weak. I don't want to lead a huge army through their territory on a wild goose hunt. We need someone to ride through there swiftly, scouting out their garrisons. Can you do this?
Thank you {?PLAYER.GENDER}madam{?}sir{\?}. [if:convo_focused_happy][ib:normal]You did a great favor to people of {ISSUE_VILLAGE}.

As you depart the scene of your victory, a man dressed in white robes emerges from a nearby wood. He tells you that you owe your victory to the intervention of Hageos Tristamos, a holy man from a century ago who assists those who fight in a noble cause, and asks that you donate half the loot to the local shrine in gratitude, where it will be used to feed the poor.
I'll make sure those who stuck their necks out for me, who sweated and bled for me, get their due.

You got the troublesome mercenaries killed off. You get no extra money for the contract, but you did get rid of them as you promised. {QUEST_GIVER.LINK} is grateful and sends {?QUEST_GIVER.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} regards.

A delegation of your troops approach you. They show you a heel of bread from your stores, crawling with maggots. A piece of dried meat is streaked with mold. Your quartermaster appears to have packed the goods carelessly, allowing moisture and pests to get inside.

Don't get involved in this. [if:convo_confused_normal][ib:hip]We've grazed our herds on these hillsides since our fathers' fathers' time. We don't care if one rich bastard gave a couple of bags of silver to another rich bastard. We don't care about title deeds or courts of law or any of that. Custom is custom, and we're not going anywhere!

As you ride out of the village, an old man in rags comes up to you and grasps the halter of your horse. "You must tell me!" he barks. "What is the tale told by the sword?" Your men gather in to see if you will humor this seemingly mad hermit.
I've always seen myself as someone who sides with the weak of this realm. I don't want to find myself at odds with you.

You can sense the power in the laminated sinews and wood of this weapon. It was made for the calloused hands of a veteran archer and {CHILD.NAME} may need years to be able to fully draw it back, but you know {?CHILD.GENDER}she{?}he{\?} will be motivated to master it.

I follow tournaments, you see, and like to both place and take bets. But of course I need someone who can not only win those tournaments but lose if necessary... if you understand what I mean. Not all the time. That would be too obvious. Here's what I propose. We enter into a partnership for five tournaments. Don't bother memorizing which ones you win and which ones you lose. Before each fight, an associate of my mine will let you know how you should place. Follow my instructions and I promise you will be rewarded handsomely. What do you say?[if:convo_bemused][ib:demure2]
What do you want from me?
I need to say something. What we did to that village - it was wrong. They're innocent farmers and they shouldn't have their homes and fields ransacked and burned like that. I won't do that again.

Knowing your reputation as a trader, two merchants in {TOWN_NAME} are asking you to arbitrate a dispute between them. The two had drawn up a contract wherein each partner had a half-share in an incoming shipment of wine. When it arrived, however, the sea captain demanded twice the price. The wealthier of the two partners was at the docks. He took the initiative and purchased the goods, deciding to take a loss for the sake of his reputation as a reliable supplier to the local taverns, but the second is poorer and wants out of the deal.

You want some mercenary work, eh? Well, we are glad to take fighters, whether they seek glory or gold. If you fight for us, you will receive {MERCENARY_AWARD}{GOLD_ICON} whenever you defeat a party of enemies, or for any other significant deed.

Your reputation as a skilled trader generally does you good, but there is always a downside. When you arrive in {TOWN}, the market inspector descends from his tower to present you with a list of fees that you supposedly accumulated over the years, based on decrees that go back several centuries. The decrees may be genuine, but in all your talk with merchants, you never heard of anyone ever paying them.

Valiant warriors have always been welcomed as citizens of the Empire and granted lands, titles and honors, {PLAYER.NAME}, but you have yet to prove yourself. Take your sword to my enemies and we may speak of this later.
You're of the {FACTION}, right? That means you're my prisoner.
